history.content:
<md>
I'm pretty sure 8 hour TAs don't get fee remission, only 10-20 hour ones do? (Someone correct me if I'm wrong) https://grad.berkeley.edu/financial/fee-remissions/</md>

children.subject: Oh whoops sorry I have no clue about that.

I'm referring to this: https://uaw2865.org/berkeley-tas-are-awarded-millions-in-back-pay-the-chronicle-of-higher-education-1-15-2020/

The forms we filled out indicated that this lawsuit applied to all 8 hour uGSI's from Fall 2017 onward, though I've only heard about it being implemented for Fall 2019 and Spring 2020 uGSI's so far. Wondering if there was any news for uGSI's of previous semesters.
I have not received anything yet. I emailed ERSO HR two months ago, and they said at that time "more information in a few weeks"... Haven't heard anything from them since then.

A quick follow-up: is the current plan for students currently enrolled at Cal to receive all of the remaining semesters they are owed (e.g. two or more), or just a single extra semester?

But thank you so much Sean! This is the most information I think anyone has heard in awhile.

The current plan is for students to receive all of the money -- the hold-up isn't the university having the money to give back (at least as far as they've told us), but instead the logistics of making sure that they're sending the money to the right people in a way that is most easily accessible.

Some students have received fee remission for the last two semesters already, but I believe that the university has treated these semesters as special cases. So when you get your fee remission you should get all of your money at once.

If this isn't the case, or you believe that you're owed more than you've been paid feel free to contact me or anyone else at UAW and we'll look into it for you! Again sorry that this process has been so opaque; there's a lot of bureaucracy to wade through, but rest assured you will get paid. :)

Just following up on this thread. Do you know if the university is still making plans to get the payment back to the first group of students by the end of June (now)? I still have not personally heard anything from the university regarding this situation.

Hi -- I'm one of the union stewards who was involved in the compromise and agreement to implement the decision. Here's what we know.

The TAs receiving fee remissions are split into two groups: those who are still enrolled at Cal and those who aren't. For those who are enrolled, the university has said that they're hoping to get to get remission back to the first group by the end of June. The main hold-ups are some hiring discrepancies between union records and university records, but to be honest we don't know much more; the process is being run by central campus, largely without much information provided to either the union or the EECS department. They have also mentioned that the emergency financial aid associated with COVID has slowed the system down, so that's another reason that things have likely been very slow.

It'll take longer to get money back to those who aren't enrolled at Cal anymore. Because many can't be electronically refunded after decoupling their CalCentral from their financial accounts, the university and union are going to have to carefully reach out to these former TAs and verify identities to prevent fraud. This will take longer and we don't have an exact timeline on this, but this process shouldn't interfere with getting money to those still enrolled at the school.

Feel free to send me an email if you have further questions -- I'm always happy to talk about what we know and what we can do to enforce that the university follows through on this decision. I'd like to also mention that I (and the union) think that these payments are taking far too long with little transparency. We'll send out updates when we know more.
Has anybody heard anything from the university yet? According to above, we should have been paid by now... :(

history.content: I was an 8 hour uGSI in Fall 2018 and Spring 2019 for a CS class. Has anyone else who uGSI'd for those semesters received their fee remission (https://uaw2865.org/berkeley-tas-are-awarded-millions-in-back-pay-the-chronicle-of-higher-education-1-15-2020/), or does anyone know what steps we should take to get that done? Thanks!
